headline.main: Gallery | The Chelsea Hotel's Resident Hairstylist Recalls Her Greatest Celebrity Clients

docs.abstract: Eighteen years after she opened Suite 303, a salon on the third floor of the Chelsea Hotel beloved by celebrities, April Barton has moved her operation downtown.

headline.print_headline: August? Get Outta Town!: Montauk Comes to Queens

docs.abstract: Playland Motel, beachfront hotel and restaurant with hip but low-key vibe, has brought East End ambiance to the Rockaways in Queens; hotel features rooms decorated by artists and baccanalian parties that can last into wee hours.
docs.lead_paragraph: Playland Motel has become a destination both for residents of the Rockaways, Queens, and for what are known locally as D.F.D.’s, or Down for the Days.

headline.main: $17,500,000 HOTEL TO REPLACE SAVOY; 29-Story Fifth Av. Structure Financed by Owners of Plaza and by Childs. RAZING TO START MONDAY 30-Story, $11,000,000 Office and Store Building Planned for 11 West 42d Street. $17,500,000 HOTEL TO REPLACE SAVOY

docs.abstract: Savoy Hotel will be demolished and replaced by 29-story apt hotel
docs.lead_paragraph: The fate of the Hotel Savoy on the south corner of Fifty-ninth Street and Fifth Avenue, which has hung in the balance for many months, was revealed yesterday when plans were announced for the immediate demolition of the famous old structure and the erection of a twenty-nine-story apartment hotel, estimated to cost about $17,500,000.

headline.main: $7,000,000 Hotel Planned for Palm Beach; Spanish Structure to Rise on Lake Worth

docs.abstract: G M Heckscher completes financial arrangements for $7,000,000 hotel on Lake Worth
docs.lead_paragraph: Hotel financing arrangements were completed in New York yesterday by G.M. Heckscher, son of August Heckscher, for the immediate erection of a $7,000,000 fireproof hotel at Palm Beach, Fla.

headline.main: GIVE DANCE JUST TO DRINK GRAPE JUICE; Secretary Bryan Invited to Festivities To-night of Women Guests at Virginia Hotel.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Virginia Hotel for young business women, at 228 East Twelfth Street, and named after Virginia Potter, a, niece of the late Bishop Potter, is all astir over the dance which the girls have arranged to give to-night at the hotel. About 250 guests are to attend, including some society folk, for there are many prominent society women among the officers and Directors of the hotel.
